text: "The Phuncky Feel One" is the second single of rap group Cypress Hill's self- titled debut album. It was released in 1991 as a single and featured the previous single of the album, "How I Could Just Kill a Man" as a B-side. It's produced by the producer of Cypress Hill, DJ Muggs and is three minutes and twenty-eight seconds long. The song also topped the Hot Rap Singles's charts. An extended version of this track appears on the UK CD single of "When the Sh-- Goes Down". ==Track listing== ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col"| Chart ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |US |77 |- |US Rap |1 |} ==References== Category:Cypress Hill songs Category:1991 singles Category:1991 songs Category:Ruffhouse Records singles Category:Songs written by DJ Muggs Category:Songs written by B-Real Category:Songs written by Sen Dog Category:Song recordings produced by DJ Muggs
title: The Phuncky Feel One
